renderers

Class RenderingPipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • renderers.RenderingPipeline

  • public class RenderingPipeline
extends java.lang.Object
    Renders the scene with the specified renderers. In the Geometry Stage you can render the scene in different ways like Blinn-Phong shading, toon shading, shadow mapping etc. In the Screen Space Stage you can perform post processing effects or draw UI elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int draw
      The index of the post processing FBO's color attachment where you should render to.
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float> floatParameters
      Map of float parameters.

      The pipeline's main FBO.

      List of geometry renderers.

      Map of matrix parameters.
      private static int notDraw
      The index of the post processing FBO's color attachment where you shouldn't render to.
      private static float renderingScale
      The pipeline's rendering scale.
      private static ScreenRenderer screenRenderer
      Renders the final texture to the screen.
      private static Fbo screenSpaceFbo
      FBO for resolving the multisampled textures and performing ping-pong rendering in the screen space stage.
      private static java.util.List<Renderer> screenSpaceRenderers
      List of screenspace renderers.
      private static boolean screenSpaceStage
      Determines whether the rendering pipeline is in the screen space stage.

      Shadowmap key.
      static java.lang.String TEXTURE_WORK
      Working frame's key.

      Map of texture parameters.

      Swaps the FBO's color attachments' index where render what you want in the Screen Space Stage.
      static void useBlinnPhongPipeline()
      Sets the rendering pipeline to use the Blinn-Phong shading for rendering meshes, draw the splines with a single color, create shadow map and some post processing effects.

    • Field Detail

      • renderingScale

        private static float renderingScale
        The pipeline's rendering scale. It scales up or down the size of the window's client area.

      • geometryFbo

        private static Fbo geometryFbo
        The pipeline's main FBO. The scene rendering performed here.

      • screenSpaceFbo

        private static Fbo screenSpaceFbo
        FBO for resolving the multisampled textures and performing ping-pong rendering in the screen space stage.

      • geometryRenderers

        private static final java.util.List<Renderer> geometryRenderers
        List of geometry renderers. You may add to this list renderers like Blinn-Phong, shadow renderer or toon renderer to actually draw the scene's geometry.

      • screenSpaceRenderers

        private static final java.util.List<Renderer> screenSpaceRenderers
        List of screenspace renderers. You may add to this list renderers like tone mapping, FXAA or UI renderers.

      • screenRenderer

        private static ScreenRenderer screenRenderer
        Renders the final texture to the screen.

      • textureParameters

        private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Texture2D> textureParameters
        Map of texture parameters.

      • matrixParameters

        private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.joml.Matrix4f> matrixParameters
        Map of matrix parameters.

      • floatParameters

        private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float> floatParameters
        Map of float parameters.

      • notDraw

        private static int notDraw
        The index of the post processing FBO's color attachment where you shouldn't render to.

      • draw

        private static int draw
        The index of the post processing FBO's color attachment where you should render to.

      • screenSpaceStage

        private static boolean screenSpaceStage
        Determines whether the rendering pipeline is in the screen space stage.

      • TEXTURE_SHADOWMAP

        public static final java.lang.String TEXTURE_SHADOWMAP
        Shadowmap key.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEXTURE_WORK

        public static final java.lang.String TEXTURE_WORK
        Working frame's key. After the scene stage you can reach here the actual work in progress version of the current frame (and the final, displayed texture at the end of the rendering).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • RenderingPipeline

        private RenderingPipeline()
        To can't create RenderingPipeline instance.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize()
        Initializes the RenderingPipeline. You should call this method before using it. However the GameLoop's initialize methods call it.

      • refresh

        private static void refresh()
        Refreshes the FBOs if the MSAA level or the rendering size changed and the screen renderer if released.

      • getRenderingScale

        public static float getRenderingScale()
        Returns the rendering scale. It scales up or down the size of the window's client area.
        Returns:
        rendering scale

      • setRenderingScale

        public static void setRenderingScale(float renderingScale)
        Sets the rendering scale to the given value. It scales up or down the size of the window's client area.
        Parameters:
        renderingScale - rendering scale
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - rendering scale must be higher than 0

      • getRenderingSize

        @NotNull
 @ReadOnly
public static org.joml.Vector2i getRenderingSize()
        Returns the pipeline's rendering size. It depends on the window's client area and the rendering scale.
        Returns:
        the pipeline's rendering size

      • bindFbo

        public static void bindFbo()
        Binds the pipelin's FBO for rendering.

      • swapFboAttachments

        public static void swapFboAttachments()
        Swaps the FBO's color attachments' index where render what you want in the Screen Space Stage. It's similar to double buffering.

      • getTextureParameter

        @Nullable
public static Texture2D getTextureParameter(@NotNull
                                                       java.lang.String key)
        Returns the specified texture parameter. The general rule is that you shouldn't release texture parameters unless yout put it to the parameters. Try to not destroy other renderers' work. On the other hand, yout should take care of your own texture parameters' release. You should always chechk whether the return value is null.
        Parameters:
        key - parameter's key
        Returns:
        texture parameter

      • setTextureParameter

        public static void setTextureParameter(@NotNull
                                       java.lang.String key,
                                       @Nullable
                                       Texture2D texture)
        Sets specified texture parameter to the given value. The general rule is that you shouldn't override texture parameters unless yout put it to the parameters. Try to not destroy other renderers' work. On the other hand, yout should take care of your own texture parameters' release.
        Parameters:
        key - parameter's key
        texture - parameter's value

      • getMatrixParameter

        @Nullable
public static org.joml.Matrix4f getMatrixParameter(@NotNull
                                                              java.lang.String key)
        Returns the specified matrix parameter. You should always chechk whether the return value is null.
        Parameters:
        key - parameter's key
        Returns:
        matrix parameter

      • setMatrixParameter

        public static void setMatrixParameter(@NotNull
                                      java.lang.String key,
                                      @Nullable
                                      org.joml.Matrix4f matrix)
        Sets specified matrix parameter to the given value. The general rule is that you shouldn't override matrix parameters unless yout put it to the parameters. Try to not destroy other renderers' work.
        Parameters:
        key - parameter's key
        matrix - parameter's value

      • getFloatParameter

        @Nullable
public static java.lang.Float getFloatParameter(@NotNull
                                                           java.lang.String key)

        Parameters:

      • setFloatParameter

        public static void setFloatParameter(@NotNull
                                     java.lang.String key,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.lang.Float value)
        Sets specified float parameter to the given value. The general rule is that you shouldn't override float parameters unless yout put it to the parameters. Try to not destroy other renderers' work.
        Parameters:
        key - parameter's key
        value - parameter's value

        public static boolean addRendererToTheEnd(@NotNull
                                          Renderer renderer)
        Adds the given renderer to the end of the appropirate stage.
        Parameters:
        renderer - renderer
        Returns:
        true if the renderer added successfully, false otherwise

public static Renderer getRenderer(boolean geometry,
                                             int index)

      • removeRenderer

        public static void removeRenderer(boolean geometry,
                                  int index)
        Removes the specified stage's indexth renderer.
        Parameters:
        geometry - specifies the list of Renderers
        index - index
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - stage can't be null

      • release

        public static void release()
        Releases the rendering pipeline.

      • removePipeline

        private static void removePipeline(@NotNull
                                   java.util.List<Renderer> list)
        Removes all the renderer's from the list and the renderers' parameters.
        Parameters:
        list - list of renderers

      • useBlinnPhongPipeline

        @NotNull
public static void useBlinnPhongPipeline()
        Sets the rendering pipeline to use the Blinn-Phong shading for rendering meshes, draw the splines with a single color, create shadow map and some post processing effects.
